name: Turkey Sloppy Joes
author: Anonymous
summary: Made with turkey, veggies, and whole wheat burger buns, this adaptation offers a healthier take on a retro favorite.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon O Organics Extra Virgin Olive Oil
6 ounces cremini (brown) mushrooms, diced or cut into small wedges
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 (14.5 ounce) can Safeway No Salt Added Diced Peeled Tomatoes (with liquid)
4 each Safeway Premium Wheat Hamburger Buns
¼ cup shaved, grated, or shredded Parmesan cheese
directions: In a large skillet over medium high heat, warm olive oil
Add carrot and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes
Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes
Add turkey, mushroom, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for 4 minutes
Stir in tomatoes, chicken broth, ketchup, and soy sauce, increase the heat to high, and bring to a boil
Reduce to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes
Position a broiler pan 3 to 4 in
Split buns and place open-faced on broiler pan
Toast the buns until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes
Add cornstarch mixture to Sloppy Joe mixture, stirring until sauce thickens, 30 to 60 seconds
To serve, place two bun halves on each plate, open faced
Top buns with Sloppy Joe mixture, dividing evenly
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if using, and serve
